title: In France, girls do better than boys in school, but women struggle more on the job market
description: Girls have been outperforming during their studies for many years, despite the persistence of a gender bias in the scientific fields.

title: Bayern Munich knock out PSG to reach Champions League quarter-finals
description: Bayern Munich defeated Paris Saint-Germain 2-0 on Wednesday, condemning PSG to a second successive last-16 exit.

title: Women march as their rights are under attack across the world
description: Thousands of women hit the streets from Kabul to Madrid on Wednesday to mark International Women's Day and stand up for rights that are coming under increasing attack.

title: Tens of thousands oppose 'foreign agent' bill in Georgia in second day of protests
description: Concern is growing that the mountainous Caucasus republic, which aspires to join the European Union and NATO, is taking an authoritarian turn.

title: Biden budget plan to cut US deficit by $3 trillion in decade says White House
description: The $3 trillion figure is higher a previous $2 trillion goal set by the United States President.

title: Macron pledges abortion constitutional right in months
description: In a speech paying tribute to the late Gisele Halimi, a feminist activist and pioneer for reproductive rights, Macron said a revision of the French constitution to make room for such a right would be submitted to Parliament.

title: War in Ukraine: Switzerland moves away from the European project
description: Taking refuge behind its historical neutrality, the Swiss Confederation refuses to interfere in the conflict and applies sanctions against Russian oligarchs too weakly.

title: Six months on, what do we know about the Nord Stream blasts?
description: Four leaks emerged on the two Nord Stream pipelines in the Baltic Sea at the end of September last year, with seismic institutes reporting they had recorded two underwater explosions.

title: French pension reform sparks rolling strikes in key sectors
description: Ahead of a seventh day of protests scheduled for Saturday, March 11, sectors in which the unions are particularly active are keeping up with action.

title: Bakhmut may fall into Russian hands 'in coming days,' NATO chief warns
description: Stoltenberg also insisted that 'it is also important to highlight that this does not necessarily reflect any turning point of the war.'

title: Large crack discovered on nuclear power plant further complicates situation for France's EDF
description: Unlike the microcracks detected in other reactors, the defect found in one of the French main electric utility company's plants is described as particularly significant.

title: UK government defends asylum plan after Nazi comparison
description: The government presented a new law on Tuesday that would bar asylum claims by anyone who reaches the UK by unauthorized means.

title: PSG gears for Champions League choc against Bayern without Neymar
description: The Parisian club plays against Bayern on Wednesday night in Munich for a place in the quarterfinals of the Champions League with Mbappe back at 100% but without Neymar.

title: French government determined to pass pension reform despite massive protests
description: French President Emmanuel Macron did not speak a word on the massive protests of March 7 against his project and has shown no sign yet he intends to do so.

title: What we know about the viral video of the execution of a Ukrainian soldier
description: In a 12-second video circulating on social networks, an unarmed man in military uniform is shot dead after shouting 'Glory to Ukraine!' The UN believes 'the video may be authentic.' Russia has not reacted.

title: In Normandy, questions remain after more than two tonnes of cocaine washed up on the shore
description: Perplexed locals in lower Normandy have been watching the elaborate ballet of armed police and spectators since numerous bales of cocaine arrived on their beaches on February 26.

title: French government is in a bind over pension reform
description: Pressured by the protest movement to give up its plan, the government appears to be increasingly in the grip of the right, which finally sees an opportunity to get its own reform adopted.

title: Ukraine denies involvement in Nord Stream sabotage following new reports
description: The Ukrainian defense minister responded to press reports connecting the Nord Stream pipeline attacks to a 'pro-Ukraine group.'

title: Calais, the French bunker border city pushing migrants into the English Channel
description: The signing of the Le Touquet Treaty between Paris and London in 2003 brought about the border's joint management with England. Twenty years later, Calais, its port and the Channel Tunnel have been covered with barbed wire and surveillance devices, with the sole result of pushing migrants into attempting to cross the Channel in inflatable boats.

title: France's EDF reports fresh crack in nuclear reactor pipe
description: The French energy group has been forced to take more than a dozen reactors offline for checks and emergency repair over the last year.

title: British government faces backlash over law to deny asylum to migrants who arrive illegally
description: The home secretary presented on Tuesday a divisive bill that would see migrants arriving in the UK illegally being removed 'within weeks' and sent back to their country of origin or to a third country.

title: French pension reform: France disrupted by second day of rolling strikes
description: Around 1.28 million people took to the streets on Tuesday in demonstrations across the country, the interior ministry said, making turnout for the sixth protest day against the reform the highest so far.

title: French justice minister gives the finger to Assemblée conservative group president, before apologizing
description: Éric Dupond-Moretti acknowledged his actions but assured that he was 'giving the finger to the presumption of innocence.'

title: In the US, pressure is mounting for Big Pharma
description: The American company Eli Lilly has decided to significantly reduce the price of its insulins for diabetes patients

title: UN Secretary-General: 'The world's Silicon Valleys must not become Death Valleys for women's rights'
description: In an article for 'Le Monde,' Antonia Guterres highlights the persistence of inequalities between men and women, most notably in  science, technology and innovation.

title: Ukranian NGO urges Hollywood to reject films funded by Russian oligarchs
description: Less than a week before the Oscars, the Ukrainian World Congress criticized the fact that a Russian oligarch had funded one of the biggest films of the year, 'Top Gun: Maverick.'

title: Paris museums show support for Iran protests through graphic design display
description: Four Parisian institutions will display art created on the fringes of the movement in support of Iranian women on International Women's Day on March 8.

title: French Senate fails to vote on pivotal article of pension reform bill
description: The Senate will continue the examination of Article 7, postponing the retirement age to 64 years, on Wednesday.

title: Fox News' Tucker Carlson distorts capitol attack footage to push pro-Trump conspiracy theories
description: The conservative commentator aired January 6 security footage working to bend the perception of the attackers as peaceful protesters who acted like tourists, despite the well-documented carnage of the day.

title: Throughout France, protests against pension reform show no sign slowing down
description: On Tuesday, March 7, 1.28 million people took to the streets in France to oppose the government's pension reform plan. Despite falling short of the record turnout in January, unions were pleased with the 'historic protest.'

title: In China, local governments face a serious financial crisis
description: The zero-Covid policy, taken to the extreme in 2022, coupled with a drop in the real estate market has cost city and provincial governments dearly.
